Description: Rim fragment of pottery cup with tall everted lip (Ionian cup); interior: on lip, broad band below four narrow bands; on bowl, wide zone of glaze above reserved band; exterior: lip glazed, handle zone reserved with one dot rosette and a plastic knucklebone; glazed below with two reserved bands close-set at lower break. Inscription on inside of lip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Knucklebone appliques are also found on a slightly different cup, Alexandria 9538.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 741, no. 1004)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.865)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5744 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
